reviews.title: Our 'splurge' hotel on our road trip round Florida!!
reviews.text: What can I say about this place.....we loved it! We stayed when it was very quiet and as a result got upgraded to a suite (I assume it was because of the season, and not due to just generally liking us!) and it was absolutely lovely. The kitchen was nicer than ours, it had a shower, jacuzzi bath, LCD TV's (plural), washer and dryer which my wife was particularly happy about as we were due a wash of our 'smalls', but most importantly of all was the superb view of the marina.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was great and I spent one great afternoon being entertained at the bar by Chris the barman, by entertained I mean he put the Football (English) on the TV and fed me some way too strong cocktails with a free Mudslide (Cheers!). I really nice bloke, as was Adam - his partner in crime.
reviews.title: Great place, staff is top notch! See you again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is perfectly located to walk down to the restaurants and shops etc.
reviews.title: High Fives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: All good!!!!!
reviews.title: I will go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spent several days at this resort in Sept. First impressions were very positive, everything looks new, well cared for and luxurious. Our suite was spacious and georgeously appointed. There was nothing more that we could have asked for - full sized fridge, dishwasher, washer and dryer, bathrobes, ohh and the bathrooms are fantastic! We had a great inside marina view with a nice balcony. Room service was quick, we also ate at Bonefish Grill which was very tasty, we didnt try Olio but will next time. The pool area is nice and service was great, very attentive and all the food came quickly. We took the shuttle over which was much easier than walking and got a ride back very quickly so it was convienent. Everyone on staff is friendly and accomodating. Roxanne at the Front desk was extremely nice and very helpful! As was the concierge (although I regettably forget her name). We had fun together setting up a birthday surprise for frends who joined for a night at the resort. Roxanne made sure to give them a fabulous suite with a huge balcony and bottle of wine for us all to enjoy! They gave us top notch treatment and we very much appreciated it! We regularly visit Naples and this place is on our list to return to!
reviews.title: We will be back! What a fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I traveled to Naples Bay Resort with my teeanage daughter, her friend, and my mother for a Presidents' week vacation, and booked NBR on the strength of the reviews here on TA. Since we wanted room to spread out I chose one of the 3-bedroom "cottages" just down Rt. 41 from the main hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful property with some service problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: The cottage was lavishly furnished, bedding was comfortable, and the unit was impressively soundproofed. We never heard people walking outside, even though we were on the ground floor. It was located just a short walk from the pool area and health club, which were both outstanding. The health club was large and well-appointed, and the pool complex had sections for both families and adults only. I was especially impressed by the lap pool and the cleanliness of the water. And the staff at the Club were very attentive.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: It was clear to me that the resort was understaffed and that housekeeping is slap-dash. For example, although we had rented the "cottage" for a week, we were provided with a minimum of bathroom amenities, towels, and toilet paper. It took me 3 phone calls to the front desk and 4 hours to finally receive more. They should have been provided from the beginning of our stay. Although the resort bills the cottage kitchens as "gourmet", ours was lacking dishcloths, towels, and a tea kettle. We were provided with flimsy kitchen garbage bags, one of which broke when I tried to take out the trash. Finally, I was told to contact the front desk upon check out, but they never answered the phone, so I just left our keys in our unit.
reviews.title: Relaxed,comfortable and well appointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In conclusion, if you consider the size of the units and the wonderful pool and health club, this is a 4-star property. However, the lack of service brings the hotel's overall rating far below 4-star.
reviews.title: Hotel Misrepresentation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé and I stayed at the Naples Bay Resort for two nights as a "layover" to our ultimate destination, Key West. Because of the superb accommodations, what was supposed to be a good, middle stopping ground for our Key West trip, turned out to be a highlight of our vacation.
reviews.title: New Year 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: This place was fantastic! They treated us like ROYALTY during our stay. Bill in reservations is an absolute sweetheart and put us in a beautiful waterfront suite. Mark, Erin and Roxanne at the front desk catered to us all week long. This was our 3rd trip to Florida and we WILL be back to this resort, hopefully for our anniversary next year. The pictures do really depict the resort and its rooms, you'd be crazy to pass this place up!!!
reviews.title: Honeymooners in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The amenities and service are clearly five-star! The lobby is beautiful; the rooms are clean and the suites are clearly worth it, with full kitchen and gilded, divided bathrooms (almost really two separate bathrooms), relaxing balcony. The curtains do not fully block the lights from the outside (especially during the holidays), but are dark enough and the bed comfortable. The view is of canals, and there are plenty of high-end shops right in the hotel complex. Parking is right under the lobby area and easily accessible. The front desk does go out of its way to help guests, and it was well noted! This is our second stay there, and we will be coming back.
reviews.title: Clearly 5-Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Guests should note that the pool, gym and spa area are a long walk from the hotel but there is a shuttle and it is well worth the visit (many pools, hottubs, modern gym). The rooms are spread out, so it can be walk to anywhere, and the hotel is on the main strip for Naples, but the downtown restaurants are a ways (again, there is a shuttle). One suggestion for the hotel, since it is a ways from the (free) beaches, is to come to some arragnment with one of the beach clubs, so that guests have easy access to drinks, umbrellas, etc. while relaxing near the water. All and all, a five star accomodation!
reviews.title: Great weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a great 4 day break at this beautiful resort. Our 1 BR suite was very large and comfortable with a full kitchen, dining / living room, screened porch, BR, and the largest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel. The grounds are immaculate with a large marina that is bordered by the hotel on 3 sides. There are shops and restaurants along the first floor creating a real village ambiance. A large condo complex is part of the resort and is located about 2 blocks away. You can take a shuttle or drive over yourself to sample the 3 pools and lazy river that are set amidst exceptional landscaping and waterfall features. The only minor complaints I can think of were the cranky TV and internet reception but these were minor inconveniences.
reviews.title: The Best Place to Stay in Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the the pleasure of staying at the Bayshore Restore in Naples, FL during our recent visit to Naples Nov 2012. We have stayed at several places in Naples and have had good experiences but our stay at the Bayshore Restore was stellar. Our stay with my husband who has additional physical needs due to a stroke over two years ago, makes traveling difficult. My accommodations at Bayshore Restore were perfect, allowing us to stay as though we were at home. The staff treated us like family and did everything to make our time there exceptional. A few of the staff that I want to point out are: General Manager Phillip Starling Erin Petersen: Front Desk Agent, Marilyn Soffer: Chef Concierge and Tricia Cory: Front Office Manage. These particular individuals were always there to greet us with a smile, asking how we were doing and more importantly truly wanted to do what ever they could to make our stay amazing and effortless.
reviews.title: Excellent Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: After having spent much time vacationing in Naples at a family member's home, we were quite reluctant to stay in a hotel. However our family is no longer in Naples and so we had to either rent a property or hotel room, neither or which appealed to us after being used to a comfortable house. After hesitatingly booking a room at Naples Bay Resort, I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised. We booked a two room suite for our family of four and were delighted with the accommodations. Everyone could spread out and have their own space and the kitchen was well equipped and quite nice. Having a washer and dryer was also a nice bonus. My husband was quite impressed with the gym facilities and we all enjoyed the beautiful pool area, which had enough variety to keep the kiddos occupied for the afternoon. The front desk staff were friendly and accommodating. We thought the location was great, close to Olde Naples, 5th Avenue and shopping areas. The resort is large enough that it still seems quiet even with a 90% full capacity. The grounds are landscaped and maintained nicely and the harbor makes a good walking area or place to have a coffee.
reviews.title: Relaxing, Spacious Home Base in Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My only criticism would be of the carpet in our suite which was a bit stained and dirty.
reviews.title: Great Escape!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also if you are booking I would request a room closer to the marina which would have a better view. We were in the far eastern building at the very end which overlooked a dingy-ish canal. Other than that, I would highly recommend this as a fantastic vacation spot for a family or couple. All in all, it was a great home base while in a Naples and not just another hotel room.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel - very, very quiet! We saw 4 other people, it was so quiet! The amenities are
reviews.title: Beautiful property, excellent atmosphere and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rated for a 4-Star Hotel, everything was just lovely! Up to date interior, nice full size
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was great and everyone was very nice. Our room was incredible with a full size kitchen, 2 bathrooms, 1 bedroom w/ king bed, living room and finally a washer & dryer! Plus we had a balcony with a gorgeous view of the marina. Great restaurants on-site as well as some shops.
reviews.title: The hotel with everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked this hotel but I did not like having to drive to the pool. The property is beautiful and the restaurant was good for the breakfast buffet but for the cost, I would have liked to walk out of my room and go to the pool and not have to drive or shuttle bus or walk a 1/2 mile to get there. The location is convenient to Tin City and and 5th Ave, which is a plus. The spa services were expensive but adequate. This hotel tries to be the Ritz Carlton but they have a long way to go.
reviews.title: Good hotel but getting to the pool is a hassle...
Great location and service!
reviews.text: We have a home in Naples but often enjoy an overnight stay in a hotel near Fifth Ave. We have stayed at many hotels in Naples and Marco Island including the Ritz Carlton and Marco Marriott. We decided to try Naples Bay Resort and were very pleased. The suites are large and include a kitchen, living and dining room. The marina views are fantastic. The hotel is clean and the staff was extremely friendly. It is within walking distance to Fifth or you can grab the water taxi at the marina which stops at all the hot spots in Naples. I would definitely recommend and plan to visit again!! Thanks for a great evening!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: Impressed with our room, view and the staff. Did not appreciate the $20/day resort fee - felt that should be included in hotel rate. When you go on vacation and the first thing you are told when you check in is there yet another fee to pay doesn't sit well. Surroundings were beautiful and I would recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is our third time staying here, I do think the front desk staff, valet, maintenance man and the grounds are top notch, however the housekeeping staff really need to take some kind of instruction on cleaning. For the price I paid I should not have to come in on the day of arrival and clean. I have had to do this every year, go out and spend money on cleaning supplies to clean the place up so I would not be disgusted by the filthy floors, dirty walls and wood work. The first year we stayed in the D building three bedroom it was beautiful and pretty clean except the tile floors were very dirty. Last yr. and this yr.Staying in I204 and we are disappointed this unit needs some serious cleaning. carpets are very dirty, walls, doors wood work, grimy stuff and fingerprints everywhere. Sofa needs replaced the cushions fall in when stiiing on it. Most places i stay at have info. books about the place, tv channels etc. nothing here! I don't think we will stay here next year if they can't guarantee us a different cottage and a clean one at best. I think the manager needs to better look over the cleaning staffs work. Our unit was poorly refreshed for our arrival. Still have 5 more days to before we go home and I have been cleaning just about everyday, the next people will have a clean place thanks to me.
reviews.title: Our third year, New Years Eve until first week of Jan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Naples Bay Resort is located close to the 5th Avenue Shopping and Dining district. While the location is close to shopping and dining, it is a bit of a walk, so you may chose to make the short drive. It has two geographic sites. A resort site which seems to have a residential / condo component to it and includes a full resort pool, etc., and a more traditional hotel which includes studio and 1 Bedroom units surrounding a marina area. This review is for the hotel portion.
reviews.title: Great Hotel / Residence Vibe - but no room service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013
reviews.text: As with other reviewers, we have only good things to say about the staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The check in process was fast, the valet was quick and friendly. It was a little walk from the check in desk to the room which was located at the far end of the 2nd hotel building. A small portion of the walk was outdoors, but the grounds are nicely landscaped and the walk not unpleasant. There is the option of valet of self parking both included in the resort fee and located close to the check in desk.
reviews.title: Always a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a one bedroom unit with a full kitchen and 2 baths. Very nicely appointed with neutral yet attractive furnishings, and quality tile and bath fixtures. There was a nice balcony with doors from the living room and the bedroom, which had great views of the marina. The rooms have plenty of outlets, closet space, ceiling fans, and are well lit. TVs in the room appeared to be smaller 32 inch flat screens, but were sufficient and good quality. There was a Bose system in the living room as well. Kitchen was clean and modern with all needed utensils. Bath was modern with full glass shower and separate tub. Bath was nicely laid out to offer essentially a two bath layout that could be opened into one large bath and included a closet with a washer/dryer in it. No real hallway noise and only slight noise from an adjoining room. The Marina was also relatively quiet and scenic.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, but..............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is available in the yacht club located in the second building near the small hotel pool. The larger resort hotel is across the street and can be walked to or visited via the hotel shuttle. There is a Bonefish Grill and an Asian Fusion restaurant in the hotel section, but no room service. Odd, because the room phones have a button for room service, and the room guide has a section for in-room dining (but no menu behind it - just a list of available wines).
reviews.title: Naples Bay Resort- A Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not let the lack of room service deter me from staying here. The rooms, grounds and staff are all superb and well worth the stay.
reviews.title: Gorgeous. Relaxing. Accommodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: The hotels staff was very welcoming and friendly. I loved the decor of the hotel. The multicolor condos surrounding the lake made it very "venice like". Great price and location. I was very very pleased with my stay.
reviews.title: Highly recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoy very much our stay at the Naples Bay Resort. Very good location, friendly serveice, nice rooms with lovely view. Would like to come again!
reviews.title: Nice place to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed a wknd getaway and this was the perfect spot. Immaculate and very large rooms. We had the king room and it included a kitchen, washer & dryer, sitting room, free internet access... Very nice workout room, great pools and spa. Professional and helpful staff members no matter where we were. Roxanne at the front desk was very pleasant, even when the phones were ringing off the hook, and Anna at the spa was great. We will definately be coming back to this place! I cannot say enough good things about Naples Bay Resort.
reviews.title: An Excellent Weekend Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: Went on a weekend trip and stayed at the Naples Bay Resort, to relax and do what I like best, go shopping. However was extremely shocked/disappointed once I entered my room and was welcomed by a bunch of ants on the night table and bed. A few got on my hands and arms! Nasty! There must have been something spilled on the night table that had not been properly cleaned because there were lots of them.
reviews.title: ANTS ON THE NIGHT TABLE AND BED

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I immediately contacted the front desk, POC: “Ms. Talia” who stated she would send someone to spray the area and I replied I did not want to stay in this room. I believe Ms. Talia had no clue as to the amount of ants in that particular room. I re-packed my belongings and waited outside the hotel room and was assigned another room a few doors down the hall.
reviews.title: great place to stay specially for the upperclass
Some service challenges
reviews.text: For us it was really not a pleasant experience. We had a 3 bedroom cottage. The sheets on one of the double beds were kings which were hard to keep on. We were told they would get new ones since the size of the bed was recently changed but this never happened. We also had a leaky toilet and asked twice to have it fixed but that did not happen, We realized there was not daily maid service but we had to ask three times for extra towels. The amenities in the kitchen were very limited. The grounds are great, pool is vey nice, and it's in a great location, but the service trumped all of that - I am sorry to say.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: We love this place. This was our third year in a row staying here. We call it "our apartment" for our annual visit to Naples. The suite is huge with a kitchen and the bathroom is bigger than anywhere we have stayed including five star hotels in Hawaii and other locales. Marina view is the best. The staff is very helpful and the location to get to downtown Naples is so convenient. It's the perfect suite with our three year old so we don't have to sleep when she does and the kitchen makes it easy to have breakfast there without leaving the room.
reviews.title: We love this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: This hotel is five stars all the way around. The rooms are huge, the staff is incredibly friendly and the hotel is immaculate. This is the perfect hotel for families. If there was one thing I'd change it would be adding more restaurants and room service.
reviews.title: Wow!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location in Naples. Some Marina view rooms do pick up the noise from the Tamiami Trail - US41. Odd that as a holiday destination the room had one chair by the desk but no second chair or sofa to sit on, felt more like a business hotel aimed at one night stays by business people travelling on their own than a comfortable room for a few nights stay. Also check out how to turn off the fridge - ours made a racket during the night which was loud enough to keep us awake for periods. It started and stopped, very frustrating.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds, well appointed rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were charming and very helpful.
reviews.title: A great place to relax!
